p: Chikungunya virus was first isolated in Tanzania by Ross and colleagues [ 48]. It is an arbovirus that belongs to the genus Alphavirus in the Togaviridae family. The virus has a diameter of 60–70 nm, a positive-sense, single-stranded RNA genome with 11,438 nucleotides and a phospholipid envelope with hemagglutinin protein spikes [ 16, 17].
